intro: Ziziphora spicata, commonly known as spiked caraway, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its aromatic leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their digestive and antispasmodic properties. Ziziphora spicata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or arid environments.
